intro: Xanthoxalis texana, commonly known as the Texas buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. It produces small, rounded seeds that are dispersed by wind. Xanthoxalis texana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
